IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: The KU Alumni Association exists to strengthen the University of Kansas by informing, engaging, and mobilizing the KU community.
IRS990.MissionDescription: The KU Alumni Association exists to strengthen the University of Kansas by informing, engaging, and mobilizing the KU community.
IRS990.Description: Alumni, Student, and University Programs - The KU Alumni Association provides one of the most comprehensive alumni programs in the country, nurturing a consistently growing, active, and powerful KU community that creates impact for the University of Kansas. Highlights include:1) Chapters and clubs - Over 60 domestic and international clubs & chapters held events focused on University issues, including campus news, student recruitment, membership advancement, and community service. Professional societies served the University through a variety of meetings, programs, and newsletters tailored to the needs of individual schools and keeping alumni informed regarding their areas of academic interest. Programmatic offerings of over 500 events attracted the attendance of nearly 58,000 alumni and friends; 2) Adams Alumni Center - Provided banquet and meeting services for University, traditional Association events, and members welcoming more than 50,000 guests and requiring more than 1,350 room rentals in the Center; 3) Support of intercollegiate athletics - Encouraged and promoted gatherings of alumni and interested persons to support the University athletics programs; 4) Kansas Honors Program - Honored more than 3,500 outstanding Kansas high school seniors in 41 programs throughout the state. Over 114,000 Kansas students have been honored since 1971; and 5)Student Programs - Provided opportunities to interact with KU alumni, access to a network of mentors, and to learn KU traditions.

Activity2.Description: Publications and communications - Providing coverage of news and issues that affect the University through publication and delivery of the award-winning, bi-monthly Kansas Alumni magazine to 45,000 Alumni Association members; production of a monthly e-newsletter, KU Connection, reaching over 112,000 members and other KU friends; and facilitation of over 1,000 e-mails annually on behalf of the Alumni Association and various University constituencies.

Activity3.Description: Alumni Records - As official record keeper for the University of Kansas for personal and mailing records for the former students and graduates of the University, the Alumni Association continually updates an active biographical records database including over 200,000 degree-holders and a total of 506,000 University alumni and friends.

Form990ScheduleCPartIV.ReturnReference: Part II-B, Line 1i - Other Activities Description
Form990ScheduleCPartIV.Explanation: Jayhawks for Higher Education, organized by the Alumni Association, is comprised of volunteer alumni throughout the state of Kansas. The function of Jayhawks for Higher Education is to encourage adequate State of Kansas support for higher educational appropriations. Jayhawks for Higher Education supports the requests of the Kansas Board of Regents for the state educational institutions under its jurisdiction. At no time does Jayhawks for Higher Education partake in partisan political matters or contribute to or support individual political campaigns. The group's only role is to encourage the support by elected state officials of the state's higher educational needs.Most communications occur via email updates to Jayhawks for Higher Education members at key points throughout the legislative session, asking them to take action by calling or corresponding with their local lawmakers on issues of importance to KU and higher education. The Alumni Association's expenses principally consist of allocated salaries, benefits, and overhead.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Part V, Line 4: Intended uses of the endowment fund.
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: The Alumni Association maintains a board-designated endowment fund established to provide funds for services to life members (Schedule D, Part V, Lines 1-2). The Alumni Association also is designated income recipient for certain permanent endowment funds under both ownership and control of the KU Endowment Association but which are held and administered by the Endowment Association in perpetuity for the Alumni Association's benefit (Schedule D, Part V, Line 3a). These endowments are reported as Beneficial Interests in Endowment Funds in Part X, Balance Sheet. Income distributions from the Beneficial Interests, which are subject to the Endowment Association's spending policies, are reflected as contributions in Part I, Line 8. Income distributions from these endowments supplement the Alumni Association's operations and also provide for upkeep and maintenance of the Adams Alumni Center.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.ReturnReference: Part I, Line 1a: Relevant information in regards to selections on 1a.
Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: Travel for companions: The Alumni Association occasionally pays travel expenses for a spouse to accompany an employee to assist in a volunteer capacity with alumni relations or donor development when attendance at an event or program is required by the employee as part of his or her work responsibilities. For spouse expenses to be reimbursable, the program or event in which the spouse is included must include spouses of guests.Health or social club dues: The Alumni Association pays the country club membership dues of certain employees. These payments are periodically analyzed and reported as taxable compensation, to the extent these membership dues payments are deemed to be personal, rather than business related.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 19: Other Organization Documents Publicly Available
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Alumni Association's governing documents are filed with the Kansas Secretary of State's office. Governing documents, policies, and audited financial statements are available upon request.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 12c: Explanation of Monitoring and Enforcement of Conflicts
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Employees and all members of the Board of Directors are annually requested to complete and submit in writing to the President & CEO a Conflict of Interest, Confidentiality, and Security Agreement form. This form discloses financial interests of the employee or director with which the Alumni Association is also potentially a party, including but not limited to transactions or agreements; potential ownership or investment interests in any entity with which the Alumni Association is negotiating a transaction or arrangement; and ownership, investment, or compensation interests in an organization which is in competition with the Alumni Association. The Chair of the Board of Directors is to become familiar with the statements of the President & CEO and all Board members. The Chair-Elect of the Board of Directors and the President & CEO are to become familiar with the statement filed by the Chair.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 11: Form 990 Review Process
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Audit Committee and Chair of the Finance Committee receive and review the Form 990 prior to filing. An Audit Committee report on the review is subsequently made to the Board of Directors, and copies of the Form 990 as filed are provided to any Board member upon request.
